description: The second season of White Album, also known as episodes 14-26.

tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Urban

node.description:
__Height:__ 153 cm 

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/NM_NANAPARTY) | [Website](https://www.mizukinana.jp/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/mizukinanaKING) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/nanamizuki_nm7)

She is admired by many of her fellow actors and fans because of the fact that she has a great amount of power and strength in her singing voice, which surprises many fans due to her regularly petite stature. She was also the winner of the "Best Musical Performance" award in the first Seiyuu Awards. She was also part of the quartet Prits alongside Yumiko Kobayashi, Natsuko Kuwatani, and Hisayo Mochizuki (all four voiced characters in the anime _Sister Princess_). Her singing style comes from singing Enka since she was young.

In July 2020, she married someone from the music industry, and they had their first child on March 16, 2021.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Ittasha in Bakuage Sentai Boonboomger

name.native: 株式会社アクアプラス

node.description: AQUAPLUS, formally U-Office and Aqua is a Japanese company which mainly specializes in the publishing and distribution of visual novels under their brand Leaf, which produces adult games. Games for all ages are released on AQUAPLUS' name alone. AQUAPLUS is also regularly involved with the production of anime based on Leaf's games. The company is also involved with music, franchised restaurants, and at one point with automobiles.
Fujima Hitoshi is a composer and arranger.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Suara_FIX) | [Website](https://fixrecords.com/suara/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suara) 

She is married to anime song composer and arranger [Fujita Junpei](https://anilist.co/staff/110557).

name.native: エレメンツ ガーデン

node.description:
__[Profile (Aria Entertainment)](https://www.ariamusic.co.jp/elements-garden/)__

A Japanese group of music composers, or a "music production brand" as they call themselves. They generally produce music for video games, anime and recording artists. They are attached to Aria Entertainment.

__Current Members:__ 
[Noriyasu Agematsu](https://anilist.co/staff/103633/Noriyasu-Agematsu) (Producer/Lyricist/Composer)
[Junpei Fujita](https://anilist.co/staff/110557/Junpei-Fujita) (Producer/Composer/Arranger)
[Hitoshi Fujima](https://anilist.co/staff/101273/Hitoshi-Fujima) (Composer/Arranger)
[Daisuke Kikuta](https://anilist.co/staff/147815/Daisuke-Kikuta) (Composer/Arranger)
[Seima Iwahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/146530/Seima-Iwahashi) (Composer/Arranger/Director)
[Ryutaro Fujinaga](https://anilist.co/staff/155960/Ryutaro-Fujinaga) (Lyricist/Composer)
[Ryota Tomaru](https://anilist.co/staff/140532/Ryota-Tomaru) (Composer/Arranger)
[Yuta Kasai](https://anilist.co/staff/259881/Yuuta-Kasai) (Composer/Arranger)
[Yusuke Takeda](https://anilist.co/staff/156645/Yusuke-Takeda) (Lyricist/Composer)
[Asuka Oda](https://anilist.co/staff/155968/Asuka-Oda) (Lyricist)
[Seima Kondou](https://anilist.co/staff/239286/Seima-Kondou) (Composer/Arranger)

__Former Members:__ 
Yasutomo Nakai (2005-2006)
[Masato Nakayama](https://anilist.co/staff/112097/Masato-Nakayama) (2007-2013)
[Evan Call](https://anilist.co/staff/119999/Evan-Call) (2012-2016)
Tomohiro Kita (2011-2016), Haruki Mori (2009-2018)
[Ryouta Suemasu](https://anilist.co/staff/155969/Ryouta-Suemasu) (2014-2019)

__[Profile](http://www.ariamusic.co.jp/elements-garden/fujita/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Junpei_Fujita)__

Member of the "music production brand" Elements Garden.

Affiliated with [Studio Silver](https://anilist.co/studio/6240/). Older brother of [You Yoshinari](https://anilist.co/staff/102998/).

He is known for having reached great expertise in many techniques from realistic animation to digital compositing. This gives him the ability to have full control over his works, often being responsible for the key frames, in-betweens, finishing, photography and backgrounds of the scenes he is in charge of.

His skilled use of coloring and compositing, together with the realistic depiction of movement make his works to be often mistaken for computer generated animation.

**Notable works outside anime:**
~!
- Ghost in the Shell (Video Game, 1997) (OP Key Animation)
- Tales of Phantasia (Video Game, 1998) (Cutscene Director, Animation Director, Key Animation)
- Valkyrie Profile Series (Video Game, 1999-2008) (Character Design, Art Design) 
- Kafu ~Kono Shirabe ga Kimi ni Todokimasu You ni~ (Visual Novel, 2001) (OP Key Animation, In-between Animation, Background Art, Digital Paint, Photography, CG Animation)
- Sakura Wars 3: Paris is Burning? (Video Game, 2001) (OP Key Animation, In-Between Animation, Background Art, Digital Paint, Photography)
- Akiiro Renka (Visual Novel, 2005) (OP Director, Animation Character Design, Key Animation, In-between Animation, Background Art, Digital Paint, Photography)
- Muv-Luv Alternative (Visual Novel, 2006) (Cutscene Mecha Design, Key Animation, In-between Animation, Background Art, Digital Paint, Photography) !~
Naoya Shimokawa is the president and representative director of eroge maker Aquaplus, which he founded in 1994. Shimokawa is also a well known composer and arranger of music for eroge.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/taizouzo)

Mostly directs and storyboards nowadays, having more or less retired as an animator.
Tadashi Kitaoka is a Composite Artist. He features frequently in [Seven Arcs](https://anilist.co/studio/35/Seven-Arcs) productions.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%AB%E3%83%AF%E3%82%BF%E3%83%92%E3%82%B5%E3%82%B7)

Hisashi Kawata is an illustrator affiliated with Leaf.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Horidesk) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/horidesk/) | [Website](http://horidesk.m78.com)

Originating from Studio Pokke, currently freelance.

**[SOUND BOX Profile (JP)](http://www.sound-box.jp/information/shizuo_k.html)** | **[SOUND BOX Profile (EN)](http://www.sound-box.jp/english/information/shizuo_k.html)**

Shizuo Kurahashi is a Japanese sound effects editor. He worked as an editor at the Nikkatsu filming studio. After that he started his sound career in ToyoOnkyo. 

He established his own company SOUND BOX in 1988. Since 1983, when the dolby stereo system got popular in Japan - he has been creating filmsounds. He has edited and arranged sounds for over 1000 works.

streamingEpisodes.title: Episode 1 - Yes, maybe the button was already pushed by then.
Episode 2 - Do you believe in long-plotted encounters?
Episode 3 - Hand in hand, shoulder to shoulder,  back to back, and then... we don't have to take off our clothes.
Episode 4 - Sometimes you feel like you understand someone beyond imagination. A lot of times it's the opposite though.
Episode 5 - It's not only those who are close to you that get in your way. The less you know someone, the harsher you are.
Episode 6 - A good way to forget your troubles...How about getting involved in somebody else's?
Episode 7 - A mental image is something that needs constant building up. It crumbles easily.
Episode 8 - The less time you have,  the more you can do. The more you do. Of course, love is no exception.
Episode 9 - Memories don't need to be prettied up like a play. The minute you say them aloud, they're all lies.
Episode 10 - Sumo Wrestling by yourself isn't lonely just because you don't have a partner. The eyes of the audience sting, too.
Episode 11 - Time won't take care of the feelings building up in your heart. It just labels them "forgotten."
Episode 12 - “Restriction.  Deception.  Deprivation.  Giving.  Waiting is more trying than all of these.”
Episode 13 - Even though the glass was tipped over, didn't you notice? Not even one drop of water remained.
Episode 14 - I've never been able to tune properly. I keep thinking that it could sound better.
Episode 15 - The things you can't find will destroy what's around you. Because they're not there, there's nothing that can be done.
Episode 16 - When I think back to my childhood, the embarrassment I feel is agonizing. Compared to that...
Episode 17 - There are lies one wants exposed. There are truths one does not want to believe in. There is one of each.
Episode 18 - Don't bugs have it too easy? They shut themselves away in their shells, and yet they're claustrophobic.
Episode 19 - They usually say you move on to the next when you're bored with what you have. Although, I usually seem  to be bored well before moving on.
Episode 20 - Love is not rational. The lovers who said this were poets, critics, and philosophers.
Episode 21 - I want to return to the fork in the road. I should have gone right instead. I've regretted every second since then.
Episode 22 - Worried you're not a good speaker? Try talking with your eyes. It'll make you want to talk in no time.
Episode 23 - We hope to catch colds in order to be nursed and fed. We don't even imagine the pain we're about to endure.
Episode 24 - Night does nothing for you. The sun is what makes things fade.
Episode 25 - It's somebody else's fault. Not mine. It's all somebody's else's fault. And not at all...
Episode 26 - And thus we sit together now, and all night long we have not stirred,
